elements: The one who raised us; the one who made us what we are; the one who waits in exile, and will rise when we bring the Dawn.
Is an acquaintance so we can hijack the cult foundation recipe.
For so long I waited at the left hand of our Shaper. Now the time has come for me to lead the Great Work.

We will need our Shaper's guidance to forge the Dawnbreaker Core from a Carcass Spark; to refine Forge ingredients to their final form; to make of a follower the Shaper's Compass; to learn of the Key from the Ligeian, Sulochana; and to complete the Work. But if we do not do his bidding swiftly, Dread will follow.

THE SHAPER SPEAKS: 'I must enact the Forge. Set a Carcass Spark at the engine's heart. Awaken it with the highest mysteries. Prepare the fiercest alchemy to fuel it. Find the flaw in the place at the land's edge that has the same name in every History. Bring the device there, with the Biting Key that the Sulochana the Ligeian knows. Employ the most potent Mysteries of Opening.'
A shining cage of curved metal, enclosing a softly glowing fragment of ancient light. It might begin our Dawn, if we can rekindle it and purify it with the fiercest alchemy.
A radiant cage of curved metal, imprisoning a blazing mote of solar fire. If we can carry it to the place where the world's flaw colours the air, we can bring the Dawn.
This is alchemy's savage summit: the deadly blue of fire outpacing light. Touch it and die.

A little brass chimaera-head given by Mrs E. as a token. When we have prepared the proper rite, she'll bear her Key to the flaw in the world, so that when I bring the Dawn, the Mansus will open for our Shaper. But she won't wait forever.
A battered tangle of bent metal, enclosing a mote of drunkenly bobbing light. We must repair it before it collapses altogether!
|A flaring tangle of bent metal. A blazing mote of solar fire quivers fitfully within. We must repair it before it collapses altogether!
A poisoned, stuttering ingot of energetic alchemy. We must soothe its rage, and quickly!
Our fountain, our joy, who rests in exile until the greatest of Feasts.
